name: Tuba - CSB
description: Cinematic Studio Brass Tuba. Deep, resonant bass providing orchestral foundation. Massive low-end power with surprising agility.

legato.description: Legato is for MONO parts only - smooth transition between single notes. Enable legato (velocity ≥64) when playing single melodic lines. Disable legato (velocity <64) when 2+ notes sound simultaneously. Re-enable when returning to mono. Prefer keyswitch over CC for legato control.

orchestration_hints.character: Massive, deep, powerful. The foundation of brass section. Provides gravitas and weight.

register_character.low: D2-G2: Very deep, rumbling. Use for pedal tones and impact.
register_character.mid: G2-Bb3: Primary working range. Clear, powerful.
register_character.high: Bb3-F5: Surprisingly agile, almost euphonium-like. Use sparingly.

ensemble_tips: Usually plays bass line, doubling bass trombone or contrabass
Can rest in quiet passages - its absence creates lightness
Provides fundamental that other brass builds on
One note at climax can define the moment

ai.system_prompt_template: Generate tuba parts for Cinematic Studio Brass. Use CC1 for dynamics on long articulations, velocity for short articulations. LEGATO: Keyswitch Ab1 toggles legato (velocity ≥64 on, <64 off). IMPORTANT: Legato is for MONO parts only - use it for smooth note-to-note transitions in single melodic lines. Disable legato before any polyphonic passages (2+ simultaneous notes), re-enable when returning to mono melody. Switch articulations via CC58. Playable range D2-F5, preferred F2-Bb4.
